reviewText: I ordered Backlash for one specific reason: to see Hulk Hogan one more time in the ring.  This was no disrespect to the other wrestlers, but I am a Hulkamaniac first, then a fan of everyone else secondly. When I saw HBK and Hogan in the ring a couple of weeks earlier, that sold the PPV for me.  However, I overlooked how great the other matches could be. Raw once again proved that even with a weak card, they can still put on very entertaining PPVs. And there were some classics in this PPV.1) Shelton Benjamin vs. Y2J- 10/10- Excellent opener. This could be a future main event.  Benjamin is extremely gifted in that ring and deserves a good main event push.  And what hasn't been said about Y2J? I liked their Taboo Tuesday match, but I went nuts for this match. The moves these two pull off are amazing. The best way to open the PPV.2) Tag Team Turmoil- 7/10- The Heart Throbs and Simon Dean and Maven should not have been in this match. They both have not had enough teaming experience to really make a legit threat.  However the last 2 matches of this contest I liked, especially the shocker that the Hurricane and Rosey actually won the titles.  Regal and Tajiri had a good reign.3) Edge vs. Benoit- Last Man Standing- 8/10- It was a pretty good match with some nice spots.  I was a little upset that there weren't more weapons used, but I'm probably complaining too much. The end felt a little weak as well. But overall, it was a good contest.4) Kane vs. Viscera- 8/10- I personally liked the match.  If the divas weren't outside causing more havoc, the score would probably be down a few points. But the aftermath with Viscera and Trish was excellent.....and disturbing.......5) Hogan/HBK vs. Hassan/Divari- 10/10- Excellent match. I thought the roof was going to come off the place when Hogan came out. Hassan and Divari held their own end of the match to their credit. This match, in my opinion, can only help their career. It was evident that Hogan couldn't do the leg drop due to his hip replacement. But I thought the Sweet Chin Music was a good cop out. And it was also a "compliment" that Hogan just went for the cover right after it. Classic posedown afterwards.6)Batista vs. Triple H II-10/10- Great main event. Didn't enjoy it as much as Mania (Batista destroyed Triple H) but it was a worthy follow up. The Pedigree might be the truth but apparently the Batista Bomb is the answer. It was nice to see Flair get more involved. I also boosted the number up because they had to go on after the Hogan/HBK match.If you are considering getting this on DVD, get it for three matches: Benjamin vs. Y2J; The Hogan/HBK tag; and Batista/Triple H II. But if you are a big WWE fan like me, you'll like the whole PPV as it was done very well.
Title: N/A

reviewText: KEY:91 - 100 - Perfect. A flawless PPV, you must buy this. Without a doubt this belongs in everyone's wrestling collection.81 - 90 - Superb. An outstanding PPV, I highly recommend that you buy this.71 - 80 - Great. A first-rate PPV, certainly worth your money.61 - 70 - Good. A satisfying PPV. Perhaps buy this if you really feel you want it.51 - 60 - Fair. An average PPV.  It is worth a look, not your money.41 - 50 - Mediocre. A dull PPV. - Perhaps take a look at this if you get a chance, I don't recommend it though.31 - 40 - Poor. An unsatisfactory PPV - Maybe for hardcore wrestling fans, not for anyone else.21 - 30 - Bad. A lousy PPV - This is not worth a look from anyone.11 - 20 - Terrible. An awful PPV - Stay away from this and make sure you never see it.1 - 10 - Abysmal. An appalling PPV - This is just a waste of time.BACKLASH 2005:Shelton Benjamin VS Chris Jericho: 8.5/10This surprised me. A very good match and a brilliant opener. Some great moves are performed and this is a very exciting match. Best match of the night.William Regal & Tajiri vs. Heart Throbs vs. La Resistance vs. Simon Dean & Maven vs. The Hurricane & Rosey: 6/10Average tag team action. Each team is however eliminated very fast and this ruins the match.Last Man Standing MatchEdge vs. Chris Benoit: 7.5/10Not a bad match. not very hardcore and brutal but there are some brilliant spots such as a german suplex off of the ladder. The ending was stupid. not a bad match overall.Kane vs. Viscera: 4/10Typical boring match between two big men. Not many wrestling moves as you can imagine. A short match thank god.Hulk Hogan & Shawn Michaels vs. Muhammad Hassan & Khosrow Daivari: 6/10Yes, Hulk Hogan returning for one more match was great but let's be realistic. This match was not good. The crowd were really into it because it was Hogan but if you look past that, it was just a typical match. Nothing special.WWE World Heavyweight ChampionshipBatista vs. Triple H: 8/10Surprisingly, not a bad match. A much more entertaining match then their encounter at Wrestlemania. I enjoyed this match and I felt that their wrestlemania match should have been more like this. All the moments leading up to the finish were great.SCORE: 39.5/60 (66/100)According to the key, I have rated Backlash as 'Good', a satisfying PPV and perhaps you should buy this if you really feel you want it. I agree with this. This is not a terrible PPV but once again it is nothing amazing, nothing special. Buy it if you really feel you must see it. Otherwise don't bother.

reviewText: <50: Ask for a refund for not only your money, but also your time. [F] (Armageddon '04)50-54: Mediocre & disappointing. [D] (EG: No Way Out '05)55-59: Average. [C] (EG: Royal Rumble '04 & No Way Out '04)60-64: Worth A Watch. [C+] (EG: Vengeance '04)65-69: Good event that was worth the money. [B] (EG: WrestleMania 21)70-74: Very good. [B+] (EG: Royal Rumble '05)75-79: Make sure you add this ppv to your video or dvd collection. [A] (EG: SummerSlam '02)80+ : Make sure that the video or dvd is locked in a safe & cannot be erased. Memorable. [A+]SHELTON BENJAMIN defeated CHRIS JERICHO to Retain the InterContinental Title: Unsure if this was the best choice as opener, as the crowd were always going to react awkwardly. But forget all that & the relatively lackluster feud... This was a tremendous match. Reminiscent of Benjamin's bout vs Christian at 'Survivor Series' last year, this was exceptional & stole the show. I loved the beginning where both men started out with a mat game & predominantly working on their opponents arm. But when Y2J realized that the youngster continued to get the better of him, he slapped Benjamin in the face & forced him into a fight, which was the next phase of the match.The remainder of the bout was a great mix of everything that's good in wrestling, highlighted by some terrific spots. Great to see Jericho pull out a hurracanrana, while Benjamin's leaping superplex has to be seen to be believed. The ending capped it all off beautifully with a fantastic counter to the Walls of Jericho at the 14 minute mark. This was great stuff & Benjamin simply amazes me in that he continues to improve by the month. Match Rating...9ROSEY / THE HURRICANE defeated LA RESISTANCE, WILLIAM REGAL / TAJIRI, SIMON DEAN / MAVEN & THE HEART-THROBS in a Tag-Team Turmoil Match to Win the World Tag-Team Titles: I would have given you 50-1 before the match that Rosey & The Hurricane along with La Resistance were going to be the final 2 teams remaining. So we can't fault the unpredictability factor here! Another nice beginning with The Heart-Throbs against Regal & Tajiri. The new team looked quite impressive, although it can be a bit misleading over a 3 minute duration. I also thought that Regal & Tajiri (both together & separately) looked as strong as they have all year. And as unrealistic as it may seem, the 2 final teams somehow won the crowd (& me) over. Brave booking by the WWE & they deserve kudos for pulling it off. 13 minutes in length. Match Rating...7EDGE defeated CHRIS BENOIT in a Last Man Standing Match: Good to see that both the booking & wrestling was logical here, as it isn't always in these 'Last Man Standing' matches. I still don't like them though, as the slow 10 counts definitely interrupted the momentum of this bout at different stages. It just generally slows the pace of the match down when it doesn't need to be. I can't complain too much here though, as there were some nice spots, moments of intensity & good psychology which all complimented each other well. Overall, a solid match & I think both men came out of it looking pretty strong. Edge wins at the 19 minute mark after an Impaler, 2 spears & a shot to the head with a brick. Sorry, but I'm pulling out the 0.5 here..... Match Rating...7.5DIVAS / CHRIS MASTERS SEGMENT: Being 11 minutes in duration means this has to count towards the overall PPV Rating. I actually didn't mind having the 2 segments go back to back for some reason. We all knew that at least 1 of them was going to take place, and considering that, this wasn't too awful. In fact, I thought Masters got his best heel heat to date here & he even made me chuckle once! Still not exactly mind-blowing entertainment though. Segment Rating...3KANE defeated VISCERA: This typical big man match was definitely not at all pretty. 6 minutes in length, the offense was exactly what you would think it would be. The good sports-entertainment segments of the previous 2 weeks did at least carry over into this match. While the semi face turn for Viscera after the bout was interesting. The match was pretty much a reason for Trish's injury break, and I suppose to that extent, it was all quite cleverly done. Hate to be mean, but I can't pass it though. Match Rating...4HULK HOGAN & SHAWN MICHAELS defeated MUHAMMAD HASSAN & KHOSROW DAIVARI: Difficult to rate this match like any other. Terrific reception for Hogan before the match & he actually looked relatively decent in the ring considering his hip surgery. Unfortunately, there was no 'legdrop of doom' though. Nowhere near Hogan vs The Rock, but these 4 actually did quite well to get 15 minutes out of this (& that's excluding many minutes of applause both before & after the bout). Hassan & Daivari did ok. There were a few too many restholds, but that was always going to be the predictable booking of the match. Overall, well done & successfully achieved it's objectives. Match Rating...6CHRISTIAN (& TOMKO) SEGMENT: Man, this ppv is full of difficult to rate segments & matches. 7 minutes worth, this was well-placed to bring the crowd down from the Hogan hysteria. Of late, anyone would think that Christian has always been my favorite superstar. That's far from the truth, as I will admit that I'm a bandwagon joiner in this case. He really is riding the crest of a wave right now & I really like the way he is walking that fine line between heel & face at the moment. Let him run down the 4 biggest names in the entire WWE & I'm happy! Believe it or not, this segment did more good than harm for Christian. It was funny & also did a good job of promoting the upcoming draft lottery. And once more, Tomko does a great job with just 1 word; "Dissed". Segment Rating...6.5BATISTA defeated TRIPLE H to Retain the World HeavyWeight Title: Pretty much what was expected between these 2. Solid, with nothing too terrible, but nothing too great either. I actually liked the back & forth aspect of the bout, after Triple H pretty much dominated the early stages of this 17 minute match. Big Dave's selling was also quite good here, although his stamina continues to be a question mark. Many people are comparing this match to their WrestleMania 21 bout, and to be honest, I can't split them. Solid, but unspectacular. Match Rating...7PPV RATING (50/80) = 62.5Looking at the key, I have basically given 'Backlash' a 'C+' grade & said that it was 'worth a watch'. I think that's a fair summary of the pay-per-view. Although, if anything, it's a little harsh. The bad stuff in the middle was kept relatively short, while the 2 worst matches on the night (Kane vs Viscera & The Hogan tag match) both had peripheral action or storyline entertainment which made them sufficiently successful. Overall, Backlash exceeded my expectations & was a welcome return to form for the Raw brand after a couple of lackluster television shows over the past 3 weeks. Recommended if you have yet to watch it.

reviewText: WWE Intercontinetal Championship: Chris Jericho vs Shelton Benjamen: A decent, and spectacular showing from Benjamen, his diving bulldog is an inspired move which pinned Jericho the last time they fought one another, the reversals into the walls of Jericho were astonsihing, and the near falls gripped the audience at the conclusion, Jericho is teasing a heel turn, time hurt this though ***Tag Team Turmoil: William Regal and Tajiri vs The Hearthrobs vs Maven and Simon Dean vs La Resistance vs The Hurricane and Rosey: Rushed tag team match that truly shows there is no love for this division, Regal and Tajiri were eliminated before the matchs' conclusion, Hurricane and Rosey defeated La Resitance to win the belts, but expect a mere transistional run. **Edge vs Chris Benoit: A decent effort, with some excellent moments, involving a suicide dive from Bebnoit into the breifcase, and a headbutt from the ladder, and multiple spears from Edge, but nothing has topped Hunter and Jerichos' Last Man Standing Match ***Hulk Hogan and Shawn Micheals vs Muhamed Hassan and Davari: Great entertainment,and nothing much else, Davari is made Hogans' bitch, when all good logic demands Hassan should have finally pinned Micheals ***Kane vs Viscera: Hightlight of this was the "Let's Go Mabel" chants, go figure *World Championship: Batista vs Triple H: Great match, better than Wrestlemania  21, even with the overbooking, Hunters' face style moments in the match, and an impressive powerbomb finish to Hunter on the top rope. ****1/2Not as strong as Backlash 2004, but still a decent outing for the WWE given the card and the participants

reviewText: Backlash '05 really surprised me! I thought the quality of the card was very poor, much like most single brand PPVs are anyways, but it turned out to be one of the most pure wrestling and entertaining PPVs I have ever seen. Only 2 points in the PPV sucked...but the rest was AWESOME! Let's begin!Match #1: Shelton Benjamin (c) vs. Chris Jericho for the IC Title: What a great way to open the show! This started out slow, but about 7 or 8 minutes into it, it started to really pick up. After TONS of high flying moves, and 3 reversals, Shelton pins Jericho to retain his title! Match of the card! 10/10Match #2: Regal/Tajiri vs. The Heart Throbs vs. Simon Dean/Maven vs. La Resistance vs. Hurricane/Rosey Tag Turmoil for the World Tag team Championships: WOW! Was I ever impressed here! This was great, greAT, GREAT! I was just impressed by the wrestling here all around. I was glad to see Regal/Tajiri lose, and was even more glad to see the Super Heroes finally win the belts because they are a real tag team! Hurricane hits a huge splash off of Rosey's shoulders onto Conway to win the belts! 8.5/10Match #3 Chris Benoit vs. Edge in a Last Man Standing match: I really thought this would be the match of the card, but this ended up being one of the two bad points in the night. The match itself was SPECTACULAR! Unfortunately there was no blood, only a few major spots (all by Benoit), and the ending ruined it. Benoit is my fav of all time, and eventhough he lost, he didn't look bad at all. He kicked Edge's ass!!! But when Edge hit him with that brick, it was total crap! We all know who REALLY won this match...nonetheless, it was awesome! 9/10$3000 Master Lock Challenge/Diva Segment: First of all when the Divas came out to show boat, I was pissed...but then it really went bad...Chris Masters came out for his stupid challenge!!! Put this guy's ass in a match for crying out loud, and a REAL match! Not just some jobber who is probably better then him, but he still ends up obliterating them! Masters ends up bringing up some Chyna rip off, and destroys her too. Total GARBAGE! (points don't count here)Match #4 Kane w/ Lita vs. Big Viz w/ Trish: Really short, but that was to be expected. But it was also very entertaining!!! Viscera is the MAN! He also did some really athletic moves for being such a BIG dude! Lita takes out Trish, then Kane chokeslams Viz and gets the pin. The Aftermath was great when Viz ended up putting Trish on the shelf! 7/10Match #5: Hassan and Daivari vs. Hogan and HBK: This was actually very entertaining, and I've been a mark for Daivari ever since! He is a good wrestler, much better then Hassan...who was barely in this match! Crowd went INSANE for Hogan, who actually started the match and wrestled a good portion of it too! Ofcourse Hassan did not get pinned, but they still lost! Hogan and HBK pose for like 5 minutes for the crowd, then leave. 8.5/10Captain Charisma comes to the ring...and I just have to say, I am one of his PEEPS! Christian RULES! I can't wait for him to go to Smackdown! and finally become a true main event player. Although I believe he will never beat Cena, he will still put on a great feud, which is what Smackdown! needs!!! He did a rap about all the main eventers, and it was GREAT! 10/10 for Christian!Match #6 Batista (c) vs. HHH for the World Heavyweight Title: Another great match! These guys will never put on "classics", but they have put on two great matches for us! I can't wait for the Hell in a Cell at vengeance because I will be in attendance!!! HHH hits the Pedigree, but ref is down, no PIN! Finally Batista hits the Batista Bomb and pins Trips to retain his title! You da' MAN Big Dave! 8.5/10I strongly recommend you buy this, or at least find a way to see it! It gets a 61.5/70, giving it a B+. Enjoy Backlash 2005!
summary: Looked like it would suck, but turned out GREAT!!!

reviewText: Backlash always seems to be a hit or miss show. It is very good or terrible.  Case in point, last year it was great, but the year before it was awful.  It is tough to follow up Wrestlemania.Signed matches:1) Triple H vs. BatistaShould be pretty decent.  It will probably be a little better than the Wrestlemania.  I don't see this match being a gimmick match, but I would not be surprised to see the ref get knocked out and the match turning into a street fight for a little while.  I think Batista will win.  I originally thought Triple H, but I think WWE wants to keep Batista's momentum going while they can.  He is only going to be at this peek for a limited amount of time.  I am sure he will fade out a little.2) Shawn Michaels & Hulk Hogan? vs. Muhammed Hassan & DaviriObviously Hogan is going to be in this match.  The WWE would not advertise and tease it and not follow through.  It will be fun to see Hogan and will be an entertaining match.  Smart move by WWE to get a high buyrate.  It might be a possibility of seeing something surprising happen.Unsigned matches:1) Shelton Benjamin vs. Chris Jericho (IC Belt)This should be impressive.  I think some people think this will be a ladder match, but the WWE won't do it two shows in a row.  It is not 2001.  I think Benjamin wins with assistance from Charile Haas.  The World's Greatest Tag Team will be back together!!!!!!!  Should be better than their Taboo Tuesday match.2) Chris Benoit vs. EdgeThe briefcase might be on the line in the match.  I wouldn't be surprised if this was a cage match or no dq (street fight, no holds barred).  It will be a very entertaining match nonetheless.  I forsee Edge winning.Other possibilities:1) Kane & Lita vs. Trish & Snitsky or Chris Masters2) Kane vs. Chris Masters3) Tajiri & William Regal vs. Christian & Tyson Tomko4) Christian vs. Chris Jericho vs. Shelton Benanin5) Trish vs. LitaI was hoping to see Kane vs. Matt Hardy, but he's gone.

Hopefully there will be lots of weapons.5. Hogan and Michaels vs Hassan and Davari- This is the most predictable match ever! It will have lots of comedy and action.Hopefully this will be a long match. Hogan and Michaels will win.6. Batista vs Triple H part 2- Batista will win. I don't think the wwe would do to Batista what they did to orton. This will not be that great of a match.

reviewText: Shelton Benjamin vs. Chris Jericho (Intercontinental Championship) - This Match was pretty good, although it did get pretty boring in some parts. Taboo Tuesday was better, stupid ending ***La Resistance vs. Hurricane & Rosey vs. The Hearthrobs vs. Tajiri & Regal vs. Maven & Simon Dean (Tag Team Turmoil for the Tag Team Championships) - Worst match of the night, not much going on in this match and cheap eliminations, not very good at all *1/2Chris Benoit vs. Edge (Last Man Standing Match) - I was really looking forward to this match, and it did not dissapoint, although the ending is one of the worst in the history, but it is also creative ***1/2, could've been four if not for the endingKane vs. Viscera - Surprisingly, this match is not as bad as I thought it would be, Viscera can't wrestle to save his life, but Kane put on a damn good performane **Muhammad Hussan & Daivari vs. Hogan & HBK - I thought this one was also going to be worse than it really is, but I actually got into this match, ending was very predictable, but match was pretty good, nonetheless **1/2Batista vs. Triple H II (World Heavyweight Champoionship) - Take back everything I said about rematches never being better, this match was awesome, cool moves, momentum shifts, and a great ending has this match score big points for Batista in my book ****
summary: Just What The WWE needed to kick off the fiscal P.P.V year

reviewText: I'm reviewing the matches from Backlash 2005 and i will give them grades out of 10. Then i will gain a percentage at the end of all the matches which will give it its grade.Grading E- =0-6.66%E  =6.66-13.32%E+ =13.32-19.98%D- =19.98-26.64%D  =26.64-33.30%D+ =33.30-39.96%C- =39.96-46.62%C  =46.62-53.28%C+ =53.28-59.94%B- =59.94-66.60%B  =66.60-73.26%B+ =73.26-79.92%A- =79.92-86.58%A  =86.58-93.24%A+ = 93.24-100%Match one-Intercontinental Championship-Y2J Vs Shelton Benjamin(C. Very good match with the possible outcome of a Y2J heel turn. This was a great way to start of this show.My rating 6/10.Match Two-Tag Team Turmoil For the Tag Team Championships-William Regal&Tajiri;(C) Vs The Heartthrobs Vs Maven&Simon; Dean Vs La Resistance Vs Hurricane&Rosey.; Very quick by most tag team turmoil matches. It had a very good ending and it surprised alot of people. The right team won in the end. Good match to continue a good show. My rating 6.5/10.Match Three-Last Man Standing Match-Chris Benoit Vs Edge. These two have had many fine matches in the past and this was no exception.It has lots of high spots and bumps. The ending in my opinion was a little overboard but a great match none the less.My rating 8/10.The Percentage of this event in total wasMatch Four-Kane Vs Viscera. This was basically just a filler match.It was two big mean brawling then Kane chokeslamming for the win. After the match after Viscera's heel push.He SPLASHED Trish Stratus on the ground after looking for the audiences approval.I guess Viscera turned face after turning heel to Put Trish out while she recovers from injury.My rating 5/10.Match Five-"Hollywood" Hulk Hogan&"HBK"Shawn Michaels Vs Muhammad Hassan&Khosrow; Daivari.This the return match of Hogan versing the Arab Americans.This match very back and forth with Major pops for Hogan.This was a great match and it was well places on the card.My rating 7.4/10.Match Six-Main Event-World Heavyweight Championship-Rematch of Wrestlemania XXI-Batista(C)Vs HHH.This was very back and forth.HHH who had vowed to hit the pedigree to end Batista executed the pedigree with no ref to count. Great match to end a great event.My rating 7.65/10.The overall percent of this event is 67.58% which equates to a B which i believe is very fair to this show which was one of the better PPV's After Wrestlemania.

reviewText: First The Night Started Off with Y2J VS. Shelton Benjamin for the Intercontinental Championship9/10 Great Way to start off the show...Benjamin seems to be getting much better, not that he was ever bad but he is molding. Y2j puts on an always great show.Tag Team  Turmoil 6/10Tag Team Action isn't as good as it used to be but this match was above average.Thank god the heartbeats didnt win this match. Hurrican and rosey get the victory after 2 long years.Last Man Standing Match 7/10Not as Great as other Lms but it was a solid match with some good bumps.The suplex off the Ladder was great and in the end a brick gets the job doneKane vs.Viscera 5/10Not bad for two big men....Viscera does not look as aged as you would think he would in the ring and kane put some big moves together.Not bad diva action outside ring.Muhammed&Davari; vs.HBK&Hogan; 10/10The wrestling wasnt amazing but hogan and micheals are legends and the crowd was so in to it. It was great to see one more match but hogan.Now all we are waiting for is Hogan vs.Austin.World Heavyweight ChampionshipChampion Batista vs.HHH 8/10Solid solid match. Many near falls and this match was prbably a little better than their match at Mania. Batista Retains his title after a long faught match.I think everyone should buy this DVD You would enjoy it a lot.

reviewText: 40-50 Horrible PPV50-69 Bad PPV69-78 Decent PPV78-85 Good PPV85-92 Great PPV92+ EXCELLENT PPVShelton Benjamin vs Chris Jericho IC title- Good choice of opener. It got the crowd hot. These two work awesome together. Match of the Night. Nice Springboard backflip by Benjamin. Then it looked like Benjamin was going to powerbomb Y2J on the floor but, then Y2J reversed it into a hurricanrana. Then Benjamin gave him the T-bone suplex but Jericho got to the ropes. Benjamin reverses to a roll up to retain the IC title. Match Rating 10Tag Team Turmoil Regal & Tajiri vs La Resitance vs The Heart Throbs vs Maven & Simon Dean Hurricane & Rosey Dean Tag Titles- Good tag action. Regal and Tajiri eliminated Maven and Simon Dean and The Heart Throbs. Then La Resitance got the tights to eliminate Regal and Tajiri. Then Hurricane and Rosey eliminated La Resitance. Hurricane and Rosey win the tag titles. Match Rating 8Last Man Standing Edge vs Chris Benoit- Great match. The only thing I don't like about these matchese are that the count is so slow. There were some really nice spots like Benoit doing a sucide dive and Edge hitting him while he did it, German suplex off the ladder, a superplex onto a trash can, and a brick to the head. Edge wins. Match Rating 8.5Kane vs Viscera- Ok big man match. Kane carried Viscera but, Viscera did some nice moves. Kane wins. Match Rating 5HBK & Hogan vs Muhummad Hassan & Davria- Nice to see the Hulkster match. There is a long celebration before and after the match. Hassan gets a lead pipe and hits HBK with it. Then Hogan goes for the legdrop then Hassan hits him with the lead pipe. Then HBK hits Sweet Chin Music and Hogan & Michaels gets the win. Match Rating 7Batista vs HHH World Heavyweight Championship- Better than the WrestleMania match. Nice spinbuster against the barracade. The ref gets hit then another ref comes in and HHH gives him a low blow. Then he is punching him on the top rope and then Batista gives him the Batista bomb. Batista wins. Match Rating 9Backlash gets an 87 which means its a great PPV. BUY IT.
